intro: Pseudorleanesia, commonly known as the false orleanesia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees native to tropical regions of South America. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or purple in color. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Pseudorleanesia species are often found in moist, shaded habitats within rainforests.
